headline: Baked Split Chicken Breast
description: Baked split chicken breasts cook up in the oven with crispy, delicious skin using this easy recipe and a few simple ingredients like dried herbs.

video.description: The recipe in this video is a very easy, but elegant, baked chicken breast recipe that looks like you've spent hours in the kitchen when you've barely lifted a finger!
video.name: How to Make Baked Split Chicken Breast

name: Baked Split Chicken Breast
recipeIngredient: 2 large bone-in chicken breast halves with skin

recipeInstructions.text: Rub chicken breasts with olive oil and garlic; sprinkle with salt, black pepper, rosemary, and basil. Arrange chicken in a large baking dish.
Refrigerate for at least 45 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Bake in the preheated oven until chicken meat is no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, 45 to 60 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the breast meat should read 165 degrees F (75 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: The way I deal with large chicken breasts is to pound them close to even thickness. Doesn't matter if they have bones. They cook more evenly. No overcooked edges. The recipe is a go-to for us.

Pseudo-pedantic us271934 should consider reading the actual recipe. Nowhere is broiler used. One reviewer suggested broiling the *final* few minutes for extra crispness. Further, the recipe as written specifically allows for varied breast sizes when range of baking time is given. Perhaps the reviewer garnered helpful clicks when the incorrect information prompted browsing cooks to reread the actual recipe.

Very nice! Earlier critique (us2793) found fault w/broiling instructions. The recipe states to switch the oven to broil the chicken breasts ONLY for the last 5-10 minutes of final cooking (nothing more!) This should yield an extra crispy skin. switch the oven to broil on high heat for the last 5.

So the "most helpful critical review" is pointless. Unsure why so many ppl marked it helpful as the op never mentions broiling anything. Maybe they changed it after posting, but who in their right mind would ever try to fully cook whole split chicken breasts under a broiler? Doesn't even say to crisp it up under the broiler. Color me confused. As it stands, it's a decent recipe. Simple, quick and repeatable. Perfect for Mondays
Delicious!! just add it some garlic powder instead of fresh and some poultry seasoning. Made mc and cheese with side of broccoli.
Perfect & juicy!
This was delicious! I marinated the chicken overnight and was not disappointed. Will definitely be making this again.
Easy and delicious! Definitely a recipe I will use again and again!

I don't usually buy the bone-in chicken breasts because you pay for bones in weight, but my husband brought these home from a sale. There were 4 organic big breast halves and I wanted to make something really good. This was so succulent. I did a few changes, I lanced each breast twice worked in OO, then I worked in my homemade SPG (salt,pepper,garlic), then sprinkled each with the Rosemary and Basil. I also refrigerated it for 3 hours. When I cooked it, I covered the pan with foil for 30 min then uncovered for another 30 min. It was perfect. Made fresh mash and steamed veggies. Everyone had a happy belly.
Delicious and juicy! You could do this with a whole chicken or any cut really.
I followed the recipe, except that I refrigerated it for almost 24 hours. It was absolutely delicious!

This recipe is good with flavor but it does not take that long to cook chicken breast’s(maybe from frozen). Cook until the interior temp is 165 not a degree more or else it is just dry and leathery. Otherwise it’s a great recipe.
It was great! Lost the recipe for a while, came back to find it and make it again!
It way overcooked the chicken. After 40 minutes in a properly heated oven, it was at 195 degrees and skin overdone.

Yes I loved it I also made a gravy for the leftovers as I made 2 batches ate 2 on the bone and removed the meat for the leftovers. Some people said they were dry but mine were not because they were huge breasts. 

The gravy helped with the leftovers and was delicious.
 
2 Chicken/Beef bouillon cubes, Low sodium or regular
2 cups of Hot water or Chicken broth, or Chicken stock, Or a combination any.
4 Tbsp Butter 
1/4 cup All-purpose flour
1 tsp Onion powder
½ to ¾ tsp Italian seasoning or salt free seasoning (recommended)
Salt, to taste if needed 
Pepper, to taste if needed

 In a small pan, add bouillon cubes, Italian Seasoning and onion powder along with the 2 cups of whichever hot liquid you choose. Or heat slowly on a stove and stir until the cubes and seasoning are mixed and fully dissolved. Remove from the heat and put this aside for now.

Heat butter in another saucepan over medium heat until fully melted. Add flour, and cook this mixture for 1 minute, constantly stirring. The butter will easily dissolve in the flour leaving no lumps

Pour the broth mixture gradually into the flour mixture, while constantly whisking everything together.

When it comes to a boil, reduce heat and simmer.

Continue whisking until gravy is thickened.

Very nice and moist. Made more herb mixture, added thyme, and rubbed a ton of it under skin. With the oil, salt and pepper with herb on skin, didn't need broiler, as it crisped up nicely. I prepped chicken and refrigerated it for about 5 hours before baking. Will do again.

This chicken was amazing! I covered it with foil for the first half hour, and uncovered it for the last. I also added garlic and onion powder and dried parsley.
 This is my new go-to baked chicken recipe!
delicious!! Very tasty and not dry at all!!
This was good. I would make again.

I did this rub on a whole chicken. I doubled the spices except the salt, blended all together and rubbed the entire chicken with the blended spices and baked until thickest part of the chicken reached 165 degrees. It was delicious
I used boneless chicken breast

Fantastic!! Easy to follow directions. My only complaint is now I have to start cooking again. My hubby loved it. I stopped cooking when my son moved out 6 years ago.. 
Thank goodness I have some awesome recipes.

My favorite way to eat chicken breasts! Loved the additional ideas of various herbs and spices! Of course baking time varies depending on the size of the chicken breasts. Using a meat thermometer is always a good idea.
These were delicious!! Tender, juicy, and devoured by my family!! Highly recommend
Made this for dinner and it was fantastic!! Meat is nice and tender and has a great flavor. I added a wee bit more fresh garlic though. I will be making this again.

I used butter and spices and olive oil mixed it all together and brushed it on to the chicken breasts and baked for 1 hour last 10 minutes I put pan under broiler and let skin get crispy it turned out great

I made this for a Valentines dinner, thinking it sounded like a good combination with my other items for dinner. 
My husbands comment was it tastes like baked chicken, it is very moist. I gave it one star because that is the only thing I cared for was the moistness, not dry, of the chicken. I should have stuck to the old standbys and not tried anything new.
Made according to recipe. My family absolutely loved it. One of them requested that I always make baked breast no other way after tasting this.
I love love love this recipe! I use Bell and Evans organic split breasts.

Awesome. Bone-in breasts are so much better. I play around with the spices - I often use zaatar. So yummy! I always use a meat thermometer so that I am sure not to over or undertake. Throw on the broiler for the last couple of minutes to get crispy skin.
I couldn't believe how easy to make and moist the chicken was. Definitely a keeper.
So simple and so good. I didn't have basil, so I substituted Italian Seasoning. Excellent flavor.
This is awesome, and will be my new go to for roasted chicken breasts! I followed the recipe exactly and added a quartered lemon in the pan. Delicious. Thanks for sharing.
Pretty basic recipe. I definitely finish it off under the broiler.
Really good, flavorful and juicy chicken. I've made this with boneless, skinless chicken too, and it was equally good. My picky eaters even liked it.
Very delicious and best of all my husband liked it
This is a great simple recipe and goes with just about any side dish! I make it exactly as the recipe follows every time, except I up the spices a little. Comes out juicy and perfectly cooked!
A little bland, but moist. Used the remaining chicken in Alfredo Sauce over linguini the next night. Very good.
So delicious. I can’t even explain the joy of eating this. My family loved it! I loved it! This recipe is perfect as is. Thank you!!!

I went lighter on the oil and the skin didn't really crisp up after 55min plus 5 under the broiler but I normally don't eat the skin anyway so the meat was still tasty. The light herbs gave it a healthy feel, but the large breasts I made needed a some extra.
Easy recipe and Juicy chicken!
Hubby loved it

Great recipe and very easy way to put tasty chicken on the table with minimal effort. I covered the chicken with aluminum foil for baking, baked 1 hour, and it came out moist and delicious. It doesn't get any easier than this! Best part is it tastes so good nobody will ever suspect how little work you actually did!
Great recipe. A keeper for sure!
I made it twice this weekend and I added grated lemon peel and some lemon juice

The combo of rosemary, basil and garlic is very flavorful, however I used a lot more of the herbs (about 1 and a fourth teaspoons per breast). I also used garlic powder (1 teaspoon per breast) rather than fresh. Even more herbs would be fine. Very easy for so much flavor. Will definitely make it again.
Loved it!
Easy delicious recipe.

I followed the recipe except I only had garlic powder and used Badia complete seasoning. The chicken turned out super moist and my picky husband loved it. This was so simple and yet so good. Will definitely make this again soon.

This was amazing! I cooked it the exact way the recipe called for it to be cooked! My kids loved it. I’ll be using this one again for sure. Glad I have one left over for lunch tomorrow. Thank you for sharing.
Easy, moist and delicious!

I love this recipe! Its easy. The chicken is juicy and flavorful.
I like to add fresh squeezed lemon juice!
good, used as much garlic that we like and dropped temperature from 375’ to 350’ for under one hour. Probed chicken for 160’ and let it set for a few minutes. Yum Yum.
Have made this recipe a few times now..DELICIOUS! My husband makes certain we have bone in chicken in our freezer and when I see it out on the counter I know what is for dinner!??

I liked this very much. The second time we made it we put all the garlic and seasonings under the skin and then let it marinate in the fridge. The meat had more flavor this time. (As much as we'd love to eat the skin we can't, so putting it under the skin is just better for us).
I used skinless boneless chicken breast and came out really good and juicy.

Absolutely one of my favorites chicken breast recipes! I am a big fan of chicken thighs because of the tenderness and juiciness but this recipe may convert me!! I made it exactly as written but I rubbed the oil mixture under the skin as well as all over. The breasts I had were very big but 60 minutes in the oven and they were baked to perfection. The skin still crisped even without the broiler.

I had 3 split chicken breasts so I decided to try this recipe. I followed the recipe exactly and it took 60 minutes to cook (I used a meat thermometer). As I ate mine, I thought it was really rubbery so I asked my husband how his piece was and he said, “this is terrible!” Not sure why it was so rubbery, but I won’t make this again.
so good! It was not dry which is rare for breasts
Delicious! I made this for my family at age 13 and they loved it! Very simple recipe to follow. 5 stars!?

This turned out amazing! My chicken breasts, even split, were too big for one serving, so I sliced across the grain for a nicer presentation. I love using bone in chicken recipes. Leaving the skin on for cooking, and tucking some of that good rub underneath, makes for moister and more flavorful meal, especially if you don't bypass the brief sitting time before cooking. It's so much tastier than bonless breasts, and as a bonus, makings for homemade chicken broth. Thank you, Prospective PhD (I hope you've got it by now!)
I made it with no bone, no skin breast in my NuWave Oven. Absolutely fabulous! I wish I'd made more for leftovers!

delicious!!! what can i say! nothing, it's just delicious !!! and easy to make, during the 45 minutes that i had to have it marinade, i vacuumed the floor ;o) and came down then continued to prepared the remainder of supper, i served it with brussels sprouts which i loved , and made cooked spinach which my partner enjoys, ! Yummy ! Ready in no time flat !

Good recipe, while the chicken was baking I sliced some mushrooms and onions, sautéed them in olive oil and garlic. Added a plastic of milk, butter And parmesan cheese . Topped the chicken with it and mozzarella cheese...

We made this just as the recipe called and for and now it is one of our “Go To” favorites!! It is Diabetic and heart friendly which makes it great for pitch ins and house bound friends. We love to add Fresh Tomatoes, Fresh mozzarella and cucumber sprinkled with chopped Basil to this meal in warmer months

Absolutely delicious! This will be in our dinner rotation from now on. It's a flexible recipe - I used the seasonings called for but did not measure. Roasted in the oven as directed for 50 minutes and the skin was a lovely brown, no need to broil. I only refrigerated the seasoned breasts in the pan for 20 minutes, short on time. That didn't seem to affect the outcome!

No changes other then I doubled the garlic. Flavor was mild with very subtle hints of rosemary or basil. It was rather large breast halves that required 3-4 minutes in oven. Meat was moist while the skin was crispy. My daughter and I enjoyed.
Easy to make and very tender. Who would of thought to take the chicken right from the refrigerator to the oven. My guests loved it.
Hubby said perfectly baked chicken tasted like a restaurant in Paris. Yay!
Very good recipe! I followed it to a T! Wouldn’t change a thing.

I made this tonight. I used pretty much all the ingredients listed. This was a huge bone -in chicken breast 1 lb & 4oz so I expected it to take more than an hour. But fortunately I checked it at 45 minutes and it was almost done. I put it under the broiler after about another 10 minutes and almost forgot about it. It was pretty crispy and was delicious. Very juicy inside. Will definitely be making this often.
The chicken came out nice and moist and had a good flavor.
It was really tasty, I had to cook it way longer due to the plump breats, it was not dried out, and it made everyone happy!

It’s so good, I’ve been telling my friends about this recipe! My tips, since I’ve made it several times already:
1. Get big ole chicken breasts and bake for the full hour. 
2. Add thick sliced carrots and potatoes to the leftover marinade and tuck between or under the breasts. 
3. Serve it boneless with crispy skin by slicing off the top half of the (big) chicken breast, leaving the bottom bony half to cool and shred later for leftovers. 
4. Your house will smell like garlic, but the chicken won’t taste garlicky. Omit the garlic if you object to the scent. Your house will smell awesome either way.
Made this dish twice and it was delish!

Definitely go heavy on the spices. For good measure, I did an additional crop-dusting of "Italian spices" blend, which I think is sage, thyme, rosemary, and oregano. The juice in the pan ended up being so nice. 

Might also benefit with just a touch of citrus, maybe orange or lemon zest to brighten it up a little.

This has become my go-to chicken roast. I've done it with different seasonings, even smothered in bbq sauce during the last 15-20 minutes. The rosemary version is top notch. but I also have used a generous shake of McCormick's grill mates Montreal Chicken Seasoning.. I'm going to try also their Rotisserie seasoning. My tip would be, if the breast are frozen It can take about an hour to reach 165 f. I just keep checking and always let it rest 10 minutes before serving. Keeps it juicy and tender.
Bone in chicken breasts are something I make frequently. Always happy to have another recipe to prepare them.
I have made your recipe many times and it's always great. Sometimes I fiddle around with the spicing. And I would add that, for browning, a quite shallow baking vessel works best. Cheers!

I didn't have bone in chicken breast on hand so I substituted boneless. As another stated cover 45 minutes and uncover broil for 10 more minutes. I also let the chicken sit for 5 minutes before serving. This was PERFECT chicken! I recieved compliments from my picky family on this being the best chicken ever. Thanks for the submission.
So delicious. My family loved it. Will definitely make again
Excellent! The house smelled great when hubby came in for dinner.

Just had this last night and it was delicious! Will definitely be making again. I doubled the marinade (added a bit of cayenne and paprika) and rubbed it under the skin and on top of the skin. I made three breasts with back attached in a cast iron skillet -- after adding the marinade, I let it marinate for a few hours. Added a bit of chicken broth and baked for an hour. Delicious! Crispy skin and moist, tender meat.
simple, easy, and delicious

Turned out pretty good. Used very large chicken breasts so they took a little longer to cook but was able to take it out at a good time since I monitored the inside temperature. I freehanded the measurements and used avocado oil and it was a nice combination. I added oregano and used regular salt instead. I heeded some advice and broiled the last 10 minutes to get a nice crispy chicken. Would make it again with smaller chicken next time and less salt.

This was pretty amazing!!! Leftovers next day were even more flavorful and juicy. I used lots of fresh garlic and fresh herbs. Fresh herbs make a huge difference. Adding this to a regular rotation. Great recipe. Did I mention easy? Easy and yummy. Total win for our family. Thanks for sharing!
Moist and delicious.
Very easy and very good. I’ll definitely make it again...soon!
It was all dried out and certainly did not look pretty.
So good! Will definitely make this again.
Followed the receipt.

This is an excellent and easy way to cook with elegant results.

I can't understand how someone (us271934) can rate a recipe because of their own ignorance. It's pretty obvious that you, the individual cook need to gauge the time needed for thickness or weight of the chicken you are going to cook! 

I had 4 very large chicken breasts, bone in, skin on, just looking at them I knew I would have to adjust the cooking time and the amounts of ingredients used. I do this for everything I cook, it's what experienced cooks do......experiment, it's fun and it's how all cooks learn! Thank you "Prospective PhD" for this quick, easy and packed with flavor recipe.
Simple, fast and delicious. Thanks!

Excellent! Season according to your meal's flavor profile. I cooked 8 large pieces. BAKED 45 min and then BROILED 15 min to crisp skin. Rearrange pieces during the broiling process to prevent burning.

Very good! I doubled the recipe, cooking 4 split breasts. Prepared it the day before, placed in baking dish, and covered with foil. Husband placed it in oven while I was at work. Also put a few [baked] red potatoes in the oven. I got home from work, removed the potatoes, removed the foil, baste the breast with pan juices, turned the oven to broil and cooked for an additional 13 minutes. It was absolutely delicious (and pretty). Will definitely make this again.
Absolutely Amazing??! I shared the recipe with my daughters and I will definitely be making this again!!!!
Omg
I used double the herbs and spices, on both sides of the breasts. The flavor was very good and I'd make these again. I did broil the skin side the last ten minutes, for a crispy side.

This was a really great baked chicken. Just the right flavors and so moist. I wasn’t able to cook it the evening I planned so it stayed in the refrigerator marinating for more than 24 hours and turned out great. 
I’ll make it again.
